answers.answer: Well I guess I posted this in the wrong week, I can't believe it's already thursday...So I'm 32 weeks on Saturday, and man, pregnancy has been rough the past two weeks...I'm having to quit my job as a cashier at a grocery store because I just simply can't do even a 4 hour shift anymore. Standing on my feet for that long just makes me sooo tired, cranky, swollen, and in pain that it's not worth the little bit of money I'm making.I've been super super tired all of the time, I was sleeping like 8 hours at night and then a 1-2 hour nap during the day but last night, holy cow I kept waking up needing to reposition, then pee, then I'd be super hungry, I got 5 hours of sleep, it's freaking early as hell, I don't have to wake up for 4 more hours but well, I'm awake!! BLAH lol.Baby is also dropping I think, she's making me waddle, punching me in the hips, and her butt is back down to being by my belly button again.My house is coming along nicely though at least :D lolAs for baby shower I was just recently in Alberta and my friends there through me a surprise baby shower which was super exciting because I didn't think I'd get one, so yay!

I like that name....SOOO much better than Mary or Mary Jane LOLI'm so excited for you...by this time tomorrow you will be a married woman!! YAY!!!As for me, I don't have my appt until tomorrow. It was supposed to be today but I rescheduled becuase today was the only opening they had this week to come put my carpet in my livign room!! WOOHOO!  So now I am sitting here waiting not so patiently for them to get here and get started.At my appt tomorrow my doc is going to manually check to see if she is head down or still breech and will also begin doing cervical checks weekly now.He told me at my last appt that he doesn't feel I'm going to go past mid- MAYBE-late august.  I realized the other night that mid august isn't but 3 1/2-4 weeks away. OH MY!!I really want her to stay put until ATLEAST 36 weeks though.  But as long as she is healthy I'm ready for her to come whenever she is.I havent' had so many sharp shooting pains in my cervix, but I've toned down on the level of physical activity I've been doing now that I've got most everything painted.  I'm still having BH.  I even have a few in the mornings before I even get out of bed!!  I feel a LOT of punches/kicks inside my hips.  It's so low and far inside my hips that sometimes I'm afraid if I sit up to fast I'm gonna squish one of her body parts LOL.I'm still having a lot of left hip pain.  It's usually worse when I get in bed at night.  I can sit at my desk or move around and it doesn't bother me as bad.  But after I've sat in bed for a bit it REALLY starts to hurt.  It makes it really difficult for getting comfortable as well.  I've also been getting a good bit of lower back pain if I'm on my feet more than a short period of time.Time is gonna fly by this next month or so, I, too, have a ton of stuff going on. Tomorrow my youngest DD is turning 7, next week my oldest starts band camp which will be from 8-1230 M-F for 3 weeks, then she goes to 3 night time practices per week for 3 weeks.  Aug 5th is my youngests 2nd birthday, my bday is aug 18th.  Plus my weekly doc appts and my DH and oldst DD have appts that alternate weeks (like she goes one week and his is the next) so it's going to be busy busy busy. Plus, after the carpet is installed I have my living room to put back together, then my dining room becuase we shoved all the LR furniture in there.  Then I gotta clean clean clean so that I'll have as much done as possible before this little girl makes her grand enterance!!I'm gonna try and post some before and after pics of my living room.  It's not completely finished but I'm so proudo f the work we've done I wanna show it off.  DH and I have done all the work ourselves, the carpet will be the first thing we've paid someone else to do.  Actually *I* have done most of the work on my own since I've been pregnant becuase DH works a lot.  check it out and let me know what you think!!!

I'm 34 weeks today....had my doctor appt early this week (on Tuesday) and all was well....doctor is still saying I'll go to 39w as long as my bp doesn't start acting up and my sugar levels stay good.  I have my next u/s next Wednesday and then next OB appt Thursday when I'll be 35w.  Other than being tired and feeling huge, I'm doing ok.  My weight has been about the same for the last 3-4 weeks at least, so I'm pretty happy with that.  I've had some stretching pains on my right side a lot lately, but I think it's just stretching and pulling.  Still having BH contractions off and on, but nothing regular.  I don't know when the OB will check my cervix....maybe next week?Baby's room is just about done, shopping for a glider and ottoman though.  I think we're going to buy it ourselves instead of getting one of the ones on Target's website (where I'm registered).  They all seem so small and I'd hate to get one I really don't like just to have someone else buy it for me.  My shower is August 1st, so I'm getting excited about that, just need people to RSVP!!!So....as of now, my c-sec is scheduled for August 27th.....now we just wait and see if baby thinks that is a good date or not!

Well, today I am officially 31 weeks! Single digit countdown now. I am doing well, I still have lots of energy, working 35 to 40 hour weeks, trying to work as much now to save up some extra cash!Since yesterday I have been having to monitor my blood sugar with one of those glucose monitors, and everything seems fine, I am always in the correct range so I am hoping at my next diabetes appt on tues they will say everything is fine and I can stop the finger pricking!I have a baby shower coming up on the 31st with mine and my bf family, I cannot wait, I also have one on Aug 15 with my work! I cannot wait.Well, my next docs appt isnt until Aug 6 so about 2 weeks from now and I am hoping everything will be good and he will check for the baby's positioning and stuff like that, I have no idea what to expect though.....I have been having so many dreams about the baby, about him being here but in every single dream, I do not have any recollection about having him, like no labour or delivery...weird huh? And in my dreams I am always asking Shawn (my boyfriend) what happened, and if I got the epidural.....etc..I hope that isn't a bad sign!

congrats on your wedding!!!!we had our 34 week u/s yesterday. my next appt they start doing the "manual cervix checks" and my strep b test, yuk. i didnt get great pics of her face but i got her nose which is mine :) shes estimated 5lb 2oz and the doc says she'll be 7-8 at birth. he was surprised by all the hair on her head, we saw little spikes around her head swaying in the fluid, it was pretty funny. shes still head down which i figured but i forgot to ask which way she was facing and where the cord is (im a bit paranoid about that). that was the last time i'll see her until she comes out!
It's getting so exciting...we're all getting so close!! Before we know it we'll be posting our birth stories :)

Congrats on the wedding waitn!!! :) You must be so excited.I'm 32 weeks now, and my ultrasound went great. Baby is measuring at 3 pounds 15 ounces, (or 4 pounds) and is currently head down. It feels like she's going to fall out of my belly button though, so that hurts a bit, but nothing else to really complain about. My next appointment is this Monday, and I pray that I've gained some form of weight. I've been able to eat fairly well for the past week and a half, so I'm hoping that it shows I have.We were supposed to have some people come work on the roof of our house, but they keep canceling because it looks like rain. So I'm hoping they do that before too much longer. The roof in the living room and bathroom fell in not too long ago, and it desperately needs fixed. They're just SOOO slow. Haha. I have no patience. Plus when it rains it leaks everywhere so blah. I voted we just demolish the house but alas.My family decided to do a small shower for my sister and I this August 1st, so I'm looking forward to that. I love when my family gets together, so it should be great. Hope everyone else is doing well. :)

Well ladies as of today I am 30 weeks and 4 days pregnant =0) Less than 10 weeks to go before I get to meet my second son! I went to my Dr's appt on Tue and my blood pressure was 130/70 and I finally got my lab results and everything looks good so as of right now I do not have preeclampsia just yet =0) I am now on weekly appointments though so that my Dr can keep a close eye on me just in case I do develop it. Also I will be getting another blood test done in either 1-2 weeks to make sure that all my levels stay down and I'm not developing preeclampsia. Baby's heartbeat was very strong as well (I always seem to forget to ask how many bpm).My hubby and I are going to try and get the nursery started this weekend, but who knows how that will go lol. I'm starting to stress about getting everything ready for the baby before he arrives since I have sooooo much too do still, we have almost all the baby items so we are not going to have a baby shower for this lil guy, I'm kind of sad but it is what it is, also my mom just got laid off and she is going to buy us our baby furniture so I told her not to worry about the baby shower, and as for hubby's mom she doesn't care about that were expecting so we wont be expecting her to buy anything for our lil guy.One more thing I'm just waiting for hubby to get off of work so we can go baby shopping =0) I LOVE shopping for my lil guy it's so much fun, after this round we only have a few more things to get and we will be all set (except for the nursery).Congrats waitn on the wedding!!!

Congratulations Mrs. Waitn838!!!  How exciting.  You must be on cloud 9.emsmom - glad to hear that you don't have preeclampsia - what a reliefclysta - great to see that your little girl is growing and that you are able to keep food down.losingmymind - fantastic job on the living room.  I am so impressed.pameladawn - sorry to hear that you have had a rough 2 weeks but hopefully you will feel better now that you are not working on your feet so much.jennyb473 - amazing that you are already having regular BH - I have no clue what to even expect with them - I have some aches and pains but no idea if they are BHcherylsangel - don't worry too much about the gluclose monitoring - sounds completely preventative.  I bet Fynn is a perfect weight.jschoch8 - have you been having bad heartburn?  I hear that lots of hair is associated with heartburn because both are related to high estrogen.I am 34 weeks today and have a doctor's appointment this evening.  I just "graduated" from physical therapy (to treat my pubis symphis dysfunction), which is a relief in many ways.  I am a little worried that I may be leaking amniotic fluid and will check with the doctor about that today.  I am finally starting to get things more together for the baby - have all of the newborn essentials.  I am trying to get into a childbirth class but many of the ones I want are full!  We'll see.  The only other thing going on is that I am having what feels like mild menstrual cramps - this is not what I have heard BH contractions are like but what do I know.  I have also been crazy busy at work trying to tie up lose ends before I head out on maternity leave. So much to do and so little time - time just keeps flying by, doesn't it.  Here's hoping we all make it through another smooth week!
funny my aunt asked me the same thing. I havent had any heartburn this pregnancy so far!

With the exception of my first all of my kids were born with a lot of hair and the heartburn with those pregnancies ranged from mild to really annoying.  With my oldest who was bald as a bowling ball I had BAD heartburn LOLNola:  BH can feel many different ways.  Sometimes they can feel almost like diarrhea cramps but you notice your uterus hardens.  Next time you have these menstrual like cramps put your hand on your belly and see if your uterus gets hard.  It won't be just one spot that hardens the entire thing will be really hard.  If it is then you are having BH, if not it could just be normal "growing pains" of pregnancy.  Sometimes BH aren't felt at all, you can only notice them when you happen to notice your uterus is hard.  If you ever notice accompany lower back ache with any cramping or contractions you should call your doctor.

thank you everybody for the congrats....im so happy everybody is still healthy and soon we will start posting our birth stories to share with everybodyi added myself on joyrenees fb page...feel free to friend request me if you would likehope everybody has a good weekend

I am now 34 weeks 1 day. I had my Dr appt yesterday. I told him about the sharp pain in my cervix and all he says is "the joys of pregnancy" What the cr*p is that? I guess it is completly normal? The pubic bone pain is getting worse and the swelling in my feet isn't going away at night like it was. It feels like my feet are bruised and hurts to walk.I love being pregnant but I can't wait to have my body back and not be in constant pain.He asked if I was ready to be done working. I told him I really can't afford to quit yet but we'll discuss again in 2 weeks at my next appointment. He said he would write the note anytime if I can't wait another 2 weeks to call him.The packing of my apartment is going VERY slow. It took me 2 hours to bubblewrap 15 picture frames. There all 10x13 or bigger. We have some really nice frames that we don't want to get dinged and scratched while in storage. I got part of the kitchen dishes packed. We only have FIVE days to have everything packed and be out of here so we have 2 days to clean and do a walk through. I am also doing a yard sale next friday and saturday.After packing last night I started havng cramps and the sharp pain in my cervix but not as bad as before. Kaelynn is very active sometimes I wish she wasn't so active. I would like to sleep.  The constant movement is very reasurring though.

My appt was short sweet and to the point today.  No cervical check this week. He said he'll do it next week.  At that appt we'll schedule my next ultrasound as well. My BP was good, I lost 2 lbs but he's not concerned.  Baby's HB was 150.  I had blood drawn to check my thyroid level. I requested this becuase I read that low thyroid function can lead to low breastmilk supply which is something I have trouble with.  I also had my finger stuck to check my hemoglobin..apparently it was low before but is fine now...It's been a rough day.  DH's back gave out on him yesterday so he's been laid up, today was oneo f my DD's Bdays and I got a call telling me my Mom has terminal cancer.  So to put it bluntly it's been a really sh!tty friday for me.

question: another week has passed and here we are again at thursday....im finally now 30 weeks and i know just about everybody is further along than me but thats ok...we are all getting closer....first, today i am getting married....actually in a couple hours ill be married...im so excited and cant believe this day has come...i never imagined id be getting married at a courthouse going on 8 months preg but this is the way it is...we are planning a beach ceremony next year when things calm downsecond, i had another u/s at 29.5 weeks and the baby is still healthy...she weighed 3 lbs 6 oz and my cervix held up...they will no longer check my cervix because after 34 weeks it doesnt matter...my next u/s is aug 16 when ill be just about 34 weeks...soooo excitingthird, i also had my 30 week ob visit this past week....i guess im starting to have contractions and its funny to me because i had none when i was preg with my son 6 years ago so im kinda ashamed i had no clue what they felt like...i def started having more of them during the day but they are very infrequent so im going with BH....it gives me hope that maybe my cervix will actually dialate on its own this preg...i never had that with my sonfourth, im just counting down the days to my baby shower...i cant wait to see everybody there and be social...i never get out of the house anymore because of the heat....aug is going to be a crazy month...my son starts his 2nd year of flag football, i go back to school (im crazy i know), and my son starts 1st grade are just some of the big things going on...there is so much on the calander plus all my doc appts...it will def be a busy time but thats goodfifth, still no name....ugh....we're doing a name the baby game at the baby shower so hopefully that will kick DF's butt in gear to compromise on a name...he mentioined having his initials so i thought ok...mckenzie rylee "M" ....i kinda like it...but will he?? what do you think of the name?how is everybody else doing? is anybody waiting on a baby shower?
title: thursday touch base - week of 7/23
